name: mri_gradunwarp
author: FreeSurfer Developers
description:
FreeSurfer is a software package for the analysis and visualization of neuroimaging data from cross-sectional and longitudinal studies. It is developed by the Laboratory for Computational Neuroimaging at the Martinos Center for Biomedical Imaging.

FreeSurfer provides full processing streams for structural and functional MRI and includes tools for linear and nonlinear registration, cortical and subcortical segmentation, cortical surface reconstruction, statistical analysis of group morphometry, diffusion MRI, PET analysis, and much more. It is also the structural MRI analysis software of choice for the Human Connectome Project.

inputs.description: Gradient coefficient input file (not to be used with --load_transtbl)
inputs.name: Gradient Coefficient File

inputs.description: Load unwarp transform table in m3z format (not to be used with --gradcoeff)
inputs.name: Load Transform Table

inputs.description: Save unwarp transform table in m3z format
inputs.name: Output Transform Table

inputs.description: Just save unwarp transform table in m3z format, requires --gradcoeff
inputs.name: Save Table Only Flag

inputs.description: Interpolation method: nearest | trilinear | cubic (default is trilinear)
inputs.name: Interpolation Type

inputs.description: Don't run anything, just check options and exit
inputs.name: Check Options Flag

inputs.description: Print out information on how to use this program
inputs.name: Help Flag

output-files.description: Saved unwarp transform table in m3z format
output-files.name: Output Transform Table
